docs.title: obj spec.notifications
docs.text: "Notifications allow you to send messages to other applications based on run and workspace events.\nMore information:\n - https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cloud-docs/workspaces/settings/notifications"

docs.title: fn spec.notifications.withEmailAddresses
docs.text:
withEmailAddresses(emailAddresses)

"The list of email addresses that will receive notification emails.\nIt is only available for Terraform Enterprise users. It is not available in HCP Terraform."

docs.title: fn spec.notifications.withEmailAddressesMixin
docs.text:
withEmailAddressesMixin(emailAddresses)

"The list of email addresses that will receive notification emails.\nIt is only available for Terraform Enterprise users. It is not available in HCP Terraform."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn spec.notifications.withEmailUsers
docs.text:
withEmailUsers(emailUsers)

"The list of users belonging to the organization that will receive notification emails."

docs.title: fn spec.notifications.withEmailUsersMixin
docs.text:
withEmailUsersMixin(emailUsers)

"The list of users belonging to the organization that will receive notification emails."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn spec.notifications.withEnabled
docs.text:
withEnabled(enabled)

"Whether the notification configuration should be enabled or not.\nDefault: true."

docs.title: fn spec.notifications.withName
docs.text:
withName(name)

"Notification name."

docs.title: fn spec.notifications.withToken
docs.text:
withToken(token)

"The token of the notification."

docs.title: fn spec.notifications.withTriggers
docs.text:
withTriggers(triggers)

"The list of run events that will trigger notifications. Trigger represents the different TFC notifications that can be sent as a run's progress transitions between different states. There are two categories of triggers: - Health Events: assessment:check_failure, assessment:drifted, assessment:failed. - Run Events: run:applying, run:completed, run:created, run:errored, run:needs_attention, run:planning."

docs.title: fn spec.notifications.withTriggersMixin
docs.text:
withTriggersMixin(triggers)

"The list of run events that will trigger notifications. Trigger represents the different TFC notifications that can be sent as a run's progress transitions between different states. There are two categories of triggers: - Health Events: assessment:check_failure, assessment:drifted, assessment:failed. - Run Events: run:applying, run:completed, run:created, run:errored, run:needs_attention, run:planning."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn spec.notifications.withType
docs.text:
withType(type)

"The type of the notification.\nMust be one of the following values: email, generic, microsoft-teams, slack."

docs.title: fn spec.notifications.withUrl
docs.text:
withUrl(url)

"The URL of the notification.\nMust match pattern: ^https?://.*"

docs.title: obj spec.project
docs.text: "Projects let you organize your workspaces into groups. Default: default organization project. More information: - https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/tutorials/cloud/projects"

docs.title: fn spec.project.withId
docs.text:
withId(id)

"Project ID.\nMust match pattern: ^prj-[a-zA-Z0-9]+$"

docs.title: fn spec.project.withName
docs.text:
withName(name)

"Project name."

docs.title: obj spec.remoteStateSharing
docs.text: "Remote state access between workspaces. By default, new workspaces in HCP Terraform do not allow other workspaces to access their state. More information: - https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cloud-docs/workspaces/state#accessing-state-from-other-workspaces"

docs.title: fn spec.remoteStateSharing.withAllWorkspaces
docs.text:
withAllWorkspaces(allWorkspaces)

"Allow access to the state for all workspaces within the same organization.\nDefault: false."

docs.title: fn spec.remoteStateSharing.withWorkspaces
docs.text:
withWorkspaces(workspaces)

"Allow access to the state for specific workspaces within the same organization."

docs.title: fn spec.remoteStateSharing.withWorkspacesMixin
docs.text:
withWorkspacesMixin(workspaces)

"Allow access to the state for specific workspaces within the same organization."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: obj spec.remoteStateSharing.workspaces
docs.text: "Allow access to the state for specific workspaces within the same organization."

docs.title: fn spec.remoteStateSharing.workspaces.withId
docs.text:
withId(id)

"Consumer Workspace ID.\nMust match pattern: ^ws-[a-zA-Z0-9]+$"

docs.title: fn spec.remoteStateSharing.workspaces.withName
docs.text:
withName(name)

"Consumer Workspace name."

docs.title: obj spec.runTasks
docs.text: "Run tasks allow HCP Terraform to interact with external systems at specific points in the HCP Terraform run lifecycle.\nMore information:\n - https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cloud-docs/workspaces/settings/run-tasks"

docs.title: fn spec.runTasks.withEnforcementLevel
docs.text:
withEnforcementLevel(enforcementLevel)

"Run Task Enforcement Level. Can be one of advisory or mandatory. Default: advisory.\nMust be one of the following values: advisory, mandatory\nDefault: advisory."

docs.title: fn spec.runTasks.withId
docs.text:
withId(id)

"Run Task ID.\nMust match pattern: ^task-[a-zA-Z0-9]+$"

docs.title: fn spec.runTasks.withName
docs.text:
withName(name)

"Run Task Name."

docs.title: fn spec.runTasks.withStage
docs.text:
withStage(stage)

"Run Task Stage.\nMust be one of the following values: pre_apply, pre_plan, post_plan.\nDefault: post_plan."

docs.title: obj spec.runTriggers
docs.text: "Run triggers allow you to connect this workspace to one or more source workspaces. These connections allow runs to queue automatically in this workspace on successful apply of runs in any of the source workspaces. More information: - https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cloud-docs/workspaces/settings/run-triggers"

docs.title: fn spec.runTriggers.withId
docs.text:
withId(id)

"Source Workspace ID.\nMust match pattern: ^ws-[a-zA-Z0-9]+$"

docs.title: fn spec.runTriggers.withName
docs.text:
withName(name)

"Source Workspace Name."

docs.title: obj spec.sshKey
docs.text: "SSH key used to clone Terraform modules.\nMore information:\n - https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cloud-docs/workspaces/settings/ssh-keys"

docs.title: fn spec.sshKey.withId
docs.text:
withId(id)

"SSH key ID.\nMust match pattern: ^sshkey-[a-zA-Z0-9]+$"

docs.title: fn spec.sshKey.withName
docs.text:
withName(name)

"SSH key name."

docs.title: obj spec.teamAccess
docs.text: "HCP Terraform workspaces can only be accessed by users with the correct permissions. You can manage permissions for a workspace on a per-team basis. When a workspace is created, only the owners team and teams with the "manage workspaces" permission can access it, with full admin permissions. These teams' access can't be removed from a workspace. More information: - https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cloud-docs/workspaces/settings/access"

docs.title: fn spec.teamAccess.withAccess
docs.text:
withAccess(access)

"There are two ways to choose which permissions a given team has on a workspace: fixed permission sets, and custom permissions. Must be one of the following values: admin, custom, plan, read, write. More information: - https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cloud-docs/users-teams-organizations/permissions#workspace-permissions"

docs.title: obj spec.teamAccess.custom
docs.text: "Custom permissions let you assign specific, finer-grained permissions to a team than the broader fixed permission sets provide.\nMore information:\n - https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cloud-docs/users-teams-organizations/permissions#custom-workspace-permissions"

docs.title: fn spec.teamAccess.custom.withRunTasks
docs.text:
withRunTasks(runTasks)

"Manage Workspace Run Tasks.\nDefault: false."

docs.title: fn spec.teamAccess.custom.withRuns
docs.text:
withRuns(runs)

"Run access.\nMust be one of the following values: apply, plan, read.\nDefault: read."

docs.title: fn spec.teamAccess.custom.withSentinel
docs.text:
withSentinel(sentinel)

"Download Sentinel mocks.\nMust be one of the following values: none, read.\nDefault: none."

docs.title: fn spec.teamAccess.custom.withStateVersions
docs.text:
withStateVersions(stateVersions)

"State access.\nMust be one of the following values: none, read, read-outputs, write.\nDefault: none."

docs.title: fn spec.teamAccess.custom.withVariables
docs.text:
withVariables(variables)

"Variable access.\nMust be one of the following values: none, read, write.\nDefault: none."

docs.title: fn spec.teamAccess.custom.withWorkspaceLocking
docs.text:
withWorkspaceLocking(workspaceLocking)

"Lock/unlock workspace.\nDefault: false."

docs.title: obj spec.teamAccess.team
docs.text: "Team to grant access.\nMore information:\n - https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cloud-docs/users-teams-organizations/teams"

docs.title: fn spec.teamAccess.team.withId
docs.text:
withId(id)

"Team ID.\nMust match pattern: ^team-[a-zA-Z0-9]+$"

docs.title: fn spec.teamAccess.team.withName
docs.text:
withName(name)

"Team name."

docs.title: obj spec.terraformVariables

Variables defined within a workspace always overwrite variables from variable sets that have the same type and the same key. More information: - https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cloud-docs/workspaces/variables - https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cloud-docs/workspaces/variables#terraform-variables"

docs.title: obj spec.versionControl
docs.text: "Settings for the workspace's VCS repository, enabling the UI/VCS-driven run workflow. Omit this argument to utilize the CLI-driven and API-driven workflows, where runs are not driven by webhooks on your VCS provider. More information: - https://www.terraform.io/cloud-docs/run/ui - https://www.terraform.io/cloud-docs/vcs"

docs.title: fn spec.versionControl.withBranch
docs.text:
withBranch(branch)

"The repository branch that Run will execute from. This defaults to the repository's default branch (e.g. main)."

docs.title: fn spec.versionControl.withOAuthTokenID
docs.text:
withOAuthTokenID(oAuthTokenID)

"The VCS Connection (OAuth Connection + Token) to use.\nMust match pattern: ^ot-[a-zA-Z0-9]+$"

docs.title: fn spec.versionControl.withRepository
docs.text:
withRepository(repository)

"A reference to your VCS repository in the format <organization>/<repository> where <organization> and <repository> refer to the organization and repository in your VCS provider."

docs.title: fn spec.versionControl.withSpeculativePlans
docs.text:
withSpeculativePlans(speculativePlans)

"Whether this workspace allows automatic speculative plans on PR. Default: true. More information: - https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cloud-docs/run/ui#speculative-plans-on-pull-requests - https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cloud-docs/run/remote-operations#speculative-plans"
